Bianca Seridan de Assis

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/3350234515830996
  • Última atualização do currículo em 20/07/2016

Veterinarian formed at Federal University of Minas Gerais - UFMG (Brazil) in 2008, Bianca Seridan completed a Master's degree in Animal Science with an emphasis in Milk Microbiology at UFMG (Brazil) in 2010. She proceeded in the sequence, to a co-supervision Ph. D study carried out in both teams: 'Ecology and physiology of microorganisms', where she works for advances of the research line 'Study and development of probiotics and prebiotics from UFMG (Brazil) and 'Bacterial biodiversity and in situ interactions' from INRA, Rennes (France). In these teams, she worked on the isolation and development of mammary probiotics against bovine mastitis, using cell culture models and molecular approaches to test lactic bacteria, notably Lactococcus lactis, and pathogenic bacteria, notably E. coli and S. aureus, interactions with host. This work achieved on a double Ph.D degree: Microbiology - UFMG (Brazil) ; and Biochemistry - Cell and molecular biology - University of Rennes1 (France) in march 2015. She aquired the experience in the field of milk microbiology and a more solid knoledge on lactic bacteria and pathogenic bacteria - host interactions. The Ph.D study was financed by the brasilian government (Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nivel Superior - CAPES) and by the french government (Bourse Excellence Eiffel). (Texto informado pelo autor)

Orientador: Jacques Robert Nicoli.
